org.piwik.sdk

Class Tracker

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.piwik.sdk.Tracker
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Dispatchable<java.lang.Integer>

    public class Tracker
extends java.lang.Object
implements Dispatchable<java.lang.Integer>
    Main tracking class This class is not Thread safe and should be externally synchronized or multiple instances used.

      • set

        public Tracker set(Tracker.QueryParams key,
          java.lang.String value)
        You can set any additional Tracking API Parameters within the SDK. This includes for example the local time (parameters h, m and s). 
         tracker.set(QueryParams.HOURS, "10");
 tracker.set(QueryParams.MINUTES, "45");
 tracker.set(QueryParams.SECONDS, "30");
        Parameters:
        key - query params name
        value - value
        Returns:
        tracker instance

      • setApplicationDomain

        public Tracker setApplicationDomain(java.lang.String domain)
        Domain used to build required parameter url (http://developer.piwik.org/api-reference/tracking-api) If domain wasn't set `Application.getPackageName()` method will be used
        Parameters:
        domain - your-domain.com

      • setDispatchInterval

        public Tracker setDispatchInterval(int dispatchInterval)
        Set the interval to 0 to dispatch events as soon as they are queued. If a negative value is used the dispatch timer will never run, a manual dispatch must be used.
        Parameters:
        dispatchInterval - in seconds

        height - the screen height as an int value

      • setScreenTitle

        public Tracker setScreenTitle(java.lang.String title)
        Correspondents to action_name of Piwik Tracking API
        Parameters:
        title - string The title of the action being tracked. It is possible to use slashes / to set one or several categories for this action. For example, Help / Feedback will create the Action Feedback in the category Help.

      • setSessionTimeout

        public void setSessionTimeout(int seconds)

      • setUserCustomVariable

        public Tracker setUserCustomVariable(int index,
                            java.lang.String name,
                            java.lang.String value)
        This methods have to be called before a call to trackScreenView. A custom variable is a custom name-value pair that you can assign to your users or screen views, and then visualize the reports of how many visits, conversions, etc. for each custom variable. A custom variable is defined by a name — for example, "User status" — and a value – for example, "LoggedIn" or "Anonymous". You can track up to 5 custom variables for each user to your app.
        Parameters:
        index - this Integer accepts values from 1 to 5. A given custom variable name must always be stored in the same "index" per session. For example, if you choose to store the variable name = "Gender" in index = 1 and you record another custom variable in index = 1, then the "Gender" variable will be deleted and replaced with the new custom variable stored in index 1.
        name - String defines the name of a specific Custom Variable such as "User type".
        value - String defines the value of a specific Custom Variable such as "Customer". Custom variable names and values are limited to 200 characters in length each.

      • setUserId

        public Tracker setUserId(long userId)

      • setUserId

        public Tracker setUserId(java.lang.String userId)
        Sets a User ID to this user (such as an email address or a username)
        Parameters:
        userId - this parameter can be set to any string. The string will be hashed, and used as "User ID".

      • trackAppDownload

        public Tracker trackAppDownload()
        Ensures that tracking application downloading will be fired only once by using SharedPreferences as flag storage

      • trackContentImpression

        public Tracker trackContentImpression(java.lang.String contentName,
                             java.lang.String contentPiece,
                             java.lang.String contentTarget)
        Tracking the impressions
        Parameters:
        contentName - The name of the content. For instance 'Ad Foo Bar'
        contentPiece - The actual content. For instance the path to an image, video, audio, any text
        contentTarget - (optional) The target of the content. For instance the URL of a landing page.

      • trackContentInteraction

        public Tracker trackContentInteraction(java.lang.String interaction,
                              java.lang.String contentName,
                              java.lang.String contentPiece,
                              java.lang.String contentTarget)
        Tracking the interactions
        Parameters:
        interaction - The name of the interaction with the content. For instance a 'click'
        contentName - The name of the content. For instance 'Ad Foo Bar'
        contentPiece - The actual content. For instance the path to an image, video, audio, any text
        contentTarget - (optional) The target the content leading to when an interaction occurs. For instance the URL of a landing page.

      • trackEvent

        public Tracker trackEvent(java.lang.String category,
                 java.lang.String action)

      • trackEvent

        public Tracker trackEvent(java.lang.String category,
                 java.lang.String action,
                 java.lang.String label)

      • trackEvent

        public Tracker trackEvent(java.lang.String category,
                 java.lang.String action,
                 java.lang.String label,
                 java.lang.Integer value)
        Events are a useful way to collect data about a user's interaction with interactive components of your app, like button presses or the use of a particular item in a game.
        Parameters:
        category - (required) – this String defines the event category. You might define event categories based on the class of user actions, like clicks or gestures or voice commands, or you might define them based upon the features available in your application (play, pause, fast forward, etc.).
        action - (required) this String defines the specific event action within the category specified. In the example, we are basically saying that the category of the event is user clicks, and the action is a button click.
        label - defines a label associated with the event. For example, if you have multiple Button controls on a screen, you might use the label to specify the specific View control identifier that was clicked.
        value - defines a numeric value associated with the event. For example, if you were tracking "Buy" button clicks, you might log the number of items being purchased, or their total cost.

      • trackException

        public void trackException(java.lang.String className,
                  java.lang.String description,
                  boolean isFatal)
        Caught exceptions are errors in your app for which you've defined exception handling code, such as the occasional timeout of a network connection during a request for data.
        Parameters:
        className - $ClassName:$lineNumber
        description - exception message
        isFatal - true if it's RunTimeException

      • trackException

        public void trackException(java.lang.Throwable ex,
                  java.lang.String description,
                  boolean isFatal)
        Caught exceptions are errors in your app for which you've defined exception handling code, such as the occasional timeout of a network connection during a request for data.
        Parameters:
        ex - exception instance
        description - exception message
        isFatal - true if it's fatal exeption

      • trackGoal

        public Tracker trackGoal(java.lang.Integer idGoal)
        By default, Goals in Piwik are defined as "matching" parts of the screen path or screen title. In this case a conversion is logged automatically. In some situations, you may want to trigger a conversion manually on other types of actions, for example: when a user submits a form when a user has stayed more than a given amount of time on the page when a user does some interaction in your Android application
        Parameters:
        idGoal - id of goal as defined in piwik goal settings

      • trackGoal

        public Tracker trackGoal(java.lang.Integer idGoal,
                int revenue)
        Tracking request will trigger a conversion for the goal of the website being tracked with this ID
        Parameters:
        idGoal - id of goal as defined in piwik goal settings
        revenue - a monetary value that was generated as revenue by this goal conversion.

      • trackNewAppDownload

        public Tracker trackNewAppDownload()
        Make sure to call this method only once per user

      • trackScreenView

        public Tracker trackScreenView(java.lang.String path)
        Tracking methods
        Parameters:
        path - required tracking param, for example: "/user/settings/billing"

      • trackScreenView

        public Tracker trackScreenView(java.lang.String path,
                      java.lang.String title)
        Parameters:
        path - view path for example: "/user/settings/billing" or just empty string ""
        title - string The title of the action being tracked. It is possible to use slashes / to set one or several categories for this action. For example, Help / Feedback will create the Action Feedback in the category Help.
